some times people want short snappy information and that's what  I want
I think this will be a grate update if your idea is chosen and I like the idea of a sea serpent please every one vote for this person's idea!!!!!

Also they’ve pretty explicitly stated that they aren’t going to add villagers that fight, not sure why everyone keeps asking for those.
We miss you Alex.
seems more like a horror mod

This is a good idea for customizing worlds, and even to prevent the general mob cap from being reached too early. For example, if you want to play on hard/hardcore but without hostile mobs (or only some of them), you can individually toggle which mobs are not/allowed to spawn during world generation. Or for an extra challenge, you can set the toggles so that only hostile mobs are spawned, and passive mobs like cows & chickens are not (unless they come with a village).

I agree the evoker should be stronger but it doesent have to be that complex. Just make them 50 or 60 health and increase their speed a bit so they can run away from the player or iron golems faster. I alredy achieved that with 4 command blocks which i place in every world i play and i think Mojang should make them stronger like that to because they just die way to quickly and since you only find a few of them in a mansion or raid fighting only 1 at a time they are quite weak. Or maby make the totem only drop 30-50% of the time from the evoker and add a nother magician mob to the raids and mansions simular to the evoker will cast spells to and has like 120 health or something like a mini boss illager wizzard and he could drop like 2 totems and be just verry rare in raids like only 1 or 2 per raid and 1 or 2 per mansion
How would you tell them who not to attack?

There is already a world gen setting for "mob griefing" (ie creepers & endermen can't destroy/move blocks), so it would make sense for there to be a setting where pet dogs can never attack other players.

This would require a whole bunch of complex coding & memory space. How would the game recognize which animals spawned from which parents? How would players be able to recognize this? What happens when parent animals die and all you're left with are a bunch of sibling animals that can't breed with each other?

This would add unnecessary complexity to the game that isn't worth the effort.
More variety in trading would be great!

The "baby mobs" section of the "Breeding" article on the Minecraft wiki already says that baby animals automatically follow adults of the same species. However, their AI is too simple to differentiate between "their mother" and other adult cats.

Regarding your lost cats: they should automatically teleport back to you if you move too far away. And if they're still nearby, you can lure them back using fish or a lead.
nope that's useless
awesome idea lets make minecraft the best a game of the year
Realy good idead. Charging mechanic on mounts is something new we realy needed for mounts to become useful even in th late game.
Yes, also why not make hoglins taimable somehow.
This is a great idea! Definitely they should use gold spears possibly with enchants.

ah yes, spartan piglans

Genius over here. I voted this!
Excellent idea. Piglins deserve more upgrades.
You can't spell 'mayhem' without 'hoglin riders'!

Absolutely agree. Having Piglins mounted would add so much more danger to the Nether, which is never a bad thing. I think to balance it, having the Piglin blow a Goat Horn first, or yell and raise the spear, would be a cool behavior and also a good way to let the player know they're about to get charged.
Hoglin riders, just what this game needed for optimal mount-related mayhem.

I think the only way the barnacle could ever work is in a huge ocean update where they finally changed the depth. Because you know it's titled monster of the ocean depths. Like depth of what the 28 blocks?
I was hoping for the barnacle honestly, it sounds ALOT better than the nautilus
do yall mean thalassophobia?

I feel that it should be summoned or at least the player has to trigger it or enter were it is.
A surprise boss fight just would not fit in the game

it should have interaction with guardians or drowned, as other hostile aquatic mobs, and occasionally eating fish if no other victim (player, villager, whatever mob) is around

would not make them destroy boats, since that would be nightmare when using boats with chests, but dismounting players or other mobs form boats sounds reasonably fine
making nautiluses fear it would be great too, making boats still viable as nautiluses could "freeze" and refuse to move

as what level of threat it should be, that is question, someone says "boss", I dont think it should be even "miniboss" (as elder guardian), it should be about as blaze level threat at most or tied to some structure/spawner, maybe if some day we get water-focused trial chamber variant where it would have sort of role of breeze (unique chamber mob)
You know, a Mounted drowned is one new threat, but a deadly barnacle to populate the seas? Sign me up.
Yes pleaseeeeee and deeper oceans aswell
It should be the Ocean's equivalent to the Warden. They could make Oceans much deeper to accomplish this, and maybe even give it a "skulky" texture.

Funny how every update someone suggests they bring back one of the mob vote losers, and it gets a ton of votes.

after copper golem rework and implementation, there is higher chance than ever we get mob vote losers
I would like to see them, even OG ones, despite I am one of few people who dont mind phantom too much and I also think however OG mob vote would end, players would hate them equally if not more than phantoms based on what was told about them
Maybe make it neutral? Minecraft doesn't want any real-life mobs that are always hostile. So either making it neutral or it have a new name would be better, in my opinion

An additional thought, what if you can use Axolotls to deter the Barnacle/ The Monster of the Ocean Depths from the attacking the player that why you have another reason to bring Axolotls with you when you travel oceans

If anyone here in the comments has further ideas, maybe a new use or feature for the Barnacle, feel free to write! Every mob should bring something with it, but unfortunately the Barnacle doesn't have that in this proposal yet.
Give the barnacle a structure with good loot like guardians! This makes it easier for people to both seek out and avoid as they so desire.
What about the name the sinker also love the post (thanks for adding this name idea 😃 )
Tho they did say no mobs from the 2017 mob vote i think if we get enough they can't deny if it is a very wanted feature

barnacle should just attach to boats and nautiluses, which slows them down, after some time, more barnacles will spawn on the boat or nautilus, making it even slower, players should kill/remove them with shears, but they will also attack. Oh, and when the whole boat or nautilus is covered, the boat will sink or the nautilus will die, and they will de-attach and find a new place

I think that the barnacle would be a cool addition to this game. I think it would be really awesome if it was in a super deep ocean biome full of bioluminescent creatures. I think some other things that might be in this ocean abyss biome could be hydrothermal vents, crabs, glowing plants, and maybe ancient ruins. I think it should be one of the more dangerous biomes in the game, so I would add many different hostile mobs in addition to this one (some ideas might include anglerfish, eels, and sharks). I recommend making the oceanic abyss biome go extremely deep, like maybe almost to the bedrock layer.

Also, I like the name Kraken the best.

You have my vote. :)
I think this should totally be in some kind of super deep super dark ocean zone with a ton of hostile mobs.

I like the idea of a barnacle, but as a small mob, maybe the size of a baby bee, that attaches to the sunken ships,... they can spawn in groups on the ship walls or as singles, and when you remove it from the ship wall, the shell of it breaks open and you and use it to tame either a crab or starfish (1 new mob idea, along with a previous mob from the mob votes)

horse armor enchanting could be nice too, at least so we can put either of protection enchantments on it to improve horse survival rates

Was coming here to make this feedback aswell, armor trims for horses alongside netherite horse armor is perfectly thematic for this update.

Mounts need as MUCH love as they can get, and now could not be a better time to give them that love. I’d be VERY disappointed with this drop if we dont at least get trims or netherite horse armor.

Trims are an amazing cosmetic feature that isnt being given enough love or focus, its the one thing that made 1.20 a good update.

I think that instead of removing this, since it requires skill and is the only way the spear can do the thing it's made for (keeping the distance between you and your enemy) they should make the shield disable the spear for a few seconds so even attribute swaping doesn't work. This would incentivize the use of shield more over totems in pvp and would make the spear a great primary weapon but would be dependant on a sidearm like how it was in real life
Better solution would be to nerf attribute swapping so you cant do it with the reach of the spear and breach mace

this will ruin combos if people use it like that ( and they will ) but attribute swapping in general needs some kind of nerf while keeping its core functionality of allowing skilled players to basically quick draw there weapons if they use it properly and its mace functionality ( not breach )
This is actually a cool idea. The spear will be balanced
It would be better to completely remove attribute swapping instead of nerfing a spear. It's a bug, not an intended feature that devs should be building the game around.
I believe they will also swim quickly away if possible. So if they are attacked prehaps it darts away propelling themselves from danger. They should at least do this above magma and bubble colomns.
Tamed ones should not do this, but you have my vote
It Should Also Hide When Attacked By A Player, But You Have My Vote
